title: Hanuman, Krishna, Shivaji Stories Among Collective Artists Networkâ€™s Indian HistoryVerse Slate (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Indiaâ€™s Collective Artists Network has rolled out its inaugural content slate through HistoryVerse, with stories drawing from Indian mythology and h
body:
Indiaâ€™s Collective Artists Network has rolled out its inaugural content slate through HistoryVerse, with stories drawing from Indian mythology and history.

	The outfit has revealed eight titles spanning theatrical features and streaming series under Collective Studios, the firmâ€™s newly established unified production entity consolidating original content development across its platforms.


	The projects draw inspiration from prominent figures and traditions in Indian mythology and history, including Hanuman, Krishna, Shiva, Shivaji, Durga, Kali, and Swami Samarth. The previously released AI-powered â€œMahabharatâ€ series serves as the initial entry in HistoryVerseâ€™s long-term strategy for adapting culturally-rooted material for contemporary audiences.
	

	Among the newly announced titles, three are being packaged as theatrical releases while two will be formatted as series, with additional projects currently in various development phases. The productions are being designed to deliver scale and immersive detail across their narratives. The slate aims to reach audiences across multiple demographics and territories.


	The productions are being developed as AI-native projects, integrating generative AI, 3D/CG animation, VFX, and selective live-action elements through the companyâ€™s proprietary technology platform. AI tools are primarily deployed for world-building and environmental design, with AI-powered 3D and animation handling character design and motion. Live-action reference footage is incorporated selectively to enhance realism and transfer performance elements, with the overall production pipeline engineered to meet theatrical, broadcast, and streaming distribution standards.
	

	â€œIâ€™ve always believed that our folklore is among the richest in the world, and that these stories, woven into the core of our cultural fabric, deserve a global stage,â€ said Vijay Subramaniam, founder and group CEO of Collective Artists Network. â€œAs HistoryVerse grows, our vision goes beyond films and series to include experiences, consumer brands, and gaming; building a larger ecosystem around these stories for audiences to engage with.â€

schema.headline: Hanuman, Krishna, Shivaji Stories Among Collective Artists Networkâ€™s Indian HistoryVerse Slate (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Shoojit Sircar, Vikramaditya Motwane Board Varun Tandonâ€™s Award-Winning â€˜Thursday Specialâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Acclaimed Indian filmmakers Shoojit Sircar and Vikramaditya Motwane have joined forces to present â€œThursday Special,â€ a short film by Indian Nationa
body:
Acclaimed Indian filmmakers Shoojit Sircar and Vikramaditya Motwane have joined forces to present â€œThursday Special,â€ a short film by Indian National Award winner Varun Tandon that has earned significant recognition on the international festival circuit.

	The intimate drama, which explores themes of love, companionship and the passage of time, recently claimed the Most Poetic Film Award at Serbiaâ€™s KÃ¼stendorf Film Festival 2025, a distinction personally selected by renowned director Emir Kusturica. 
	

	â€œThursday Specialâ€ stars Anubha Fatehpuria and Ramakanth Dayama as Ram and Shakuntala, an elderly married couple whose relationship is anchored by their mutual passion for food and a weekly Thursday tradition. Karan Luthra produces, with Tandon penning the script alongside co-writer and executive producer Krati Tandon.


	Sircar, whose directing credits include â€œPiku,â€ â€œVicky Donorâ€ and â€œOctober,â€ praised the filmâ€™s understated approach. â€œThursday Special really moved me with its simplicity and gentle storytelling,â€ he said, drawing comparisons to his own unreleased feature â€œShoe Bite,â€ which starred Amitabh Bachchan.

	â€œVarunâ€™s nuanced portrayal of companionship, ageing, and love is heartfelt and mature. Itâ€™s a delicately handled take on marriage and middle-age relationships â€“ especially impressive for a young filmmaker â€“ and it reminded me, in a way, of my unreleased film Shoe Bite,â€ Sircar added. â€œThe storytelling in â€˜Thursday Specialâ€™ is clear and sincere, with every department serving the story. Knowing that Varun has made over 15 short films highlighted his passion and dedication, and I felt both he and the film deserved support.â€
	

	Motwane, known for pushing boundaries in contemporary Indian cinema, emphasized the filmâ€™s focus on overlooked narratives. â€œWhen I watched â€˜Thursday Specialâ€™, I was struck by the fact that though all the stories we tell are human stories, we tend to forget that there are so many other stories out there in the mundane, and in the lives of people who you would not expect to have unique stories,â€ he said.

	â€œI really enjoyed the film. I think people should see it, and they will like it. Itâ€™s a film that you can talk about and discuss and not just from an aesthetic perspective. While itâ€™s beautifully directed and performed, it is truly special in terms of pure story, pure feeling,â€ Motwane added.

	For Tandon, whose short â€œSyaahiâ€ earned a Special Jury Award at the Indian National Film Awards, the project represents a long-cherished creative vision. â€œThis is a story that has stayed in my heart for years. I was taken over by the sheer excitement and curiosity to see these characters on screen and watch their lives unfold,â€ said the filmmaker, who also directed the documentary short â€œDribbling Dreams.â€

	â€œThursday Special is a heartfelt portrayal of a couple whose lives revolve around their shared passion for food. Through their weekly tradition, we delve into their world and witness the intricate layers of their relationship,â€ Tandon added.

	The short has amassed more than 25 awards across global festivals since its premiere at Mecal Pro in Barcelona. Notable wins include Best Narrative Short at the New York Indian Film Festival, Best International Short Film at the Adelaide Independent Film Festival, and Best Narrative Short at the Tryon International Film Festival.

	The film is set for release on Jan. 29 via the Humans of Cinema YouTube channel.

schema.headline: Shoojit Sircar, Vikramaditya Motwane Board Varun Tandonâ€™s Award-Winning â€˜Thursday Specialâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Brooklyn Beckham Says â€˜I Do Not Want to Reconcileâ€™ With Parents David and Victoria in Lengthy Statement About Family Feud: â€˜I Have Been Controlledâ€™ for â€˜Most of My Lifeâ€™
description:
The Beckham family feud has boiled over from tabloid fascination to a burning Hollywood scandal.

	Brooklyn Beckham released a lengthy statement to
body:
The Beckham family feud has boiled over from tabloid fascination to a burning Hollywood scandal.

	Brooklyn Beckham released a lengthy statement to his Instagram Stories on Monday morning, accusing his parents, David and Victoria, of trying to â€œcontrol the narrativesâ€ around his life and â€œtrying endlessly to ruinâ€ his relationship with wife Nicola Peltz. The eldest Beckham has been estranged from his family for roughly three years, a painful saga with Instagram unfollows and endless press leaks that have overshadowed the public profiles and work of all involved since it began. 
	

	â€œI had been silent for years and made every effort to keep these matters private,â€ Beckham wrote. â€œUnfortunately, my parents and their team have continued to go to the press, leaving me no choice but to speak for myself and tell the truth about only some of the lies that have been printed. I do not want to reconcile with my family. Iâ€™m not being controlled, Iâ€™m standing up for myself for the first time in my life.â€


	A  rep for David Beckham had no comment. Representatives for Victoria Beckham did not immediately respond to a request from Variety. The family dynamic that Brooklyn Beckham alleged in his confessional social media post paints a deeply unflattering portrait of his father and siblings. Victoria Beckham gets the worst of it, accused of momzilla behavior that instantly prompts the question, â€œRyan Murphy adaptation, when?â€ in Hollywood these days. 

	Beckham accused his parents of putting â€œcountless liesâ€ in the media about him and his family. He described his relationship with his parents and siblings as â€œinauthentic,â€ buoyed by â€œperformative social media postsâ€ and family events.
	

	Beckham also claimed his parents tried everything they could to curb his relationship with Peltz. He said his mom â€œcancelled making Nicolaâ€™s dress in the eleventh hourâ€ and â€œattempted to bribeâ€ him into signing away the rights to his name before he got married.

	On his wedding day, Beckham said his mother hijacked his first dance with Peltz and â€œdanced very inappropriatelyâ€ on him.

	He recalled, â€œMarc Anthony called me to the stage, where in the schedule was a planned to be my roamntic dance with my wife but instead my mum was waiting to dance with me instead. She danced very inappropriately on me in front of everyone. Iâ€™ve never felt more uncomfortable or humiliated in my entire life.â€

	He ended his statement by saying the narrative that his wife controls his life is â€œcompletely backwards,â€ and instead, itâ€™s his parents who have been manipulating him. These are the kind of pearl-clutching specifics that can derail press tours for ventures like Victoriaâ€™s eponymous fashion brand, as well as tarnish a complicated Beckham legacy that seemingly settled with the family enshrined in a bubble of adoration and protection. 

	â€œMy wife and I do not want a life shaped by image, press or manipulation,â€ he concluded. â€œAll we want is peace, privacy and happiness for us and our future family.â€

schema.headline: Brooklyn Beckham Says â€˜I Do Not Want to Reconcileâ€™ With Parents David and Victoria in Lengthy Statement About Family Feud: â€˜I Have Been Controlledâ€™ for â€˜Most of My Lifeâ€™

title: CFPÂ National Championship 2026 Livestream: How to Watch Miami Hurricanes vs. Indiana Hoosiers Online Without Cable for Free

	After thr
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	After thrilling Fiesta Bowl and Peach Bowl games, the College Football Playoff (CFP) National Championship is set with two college powerhouses competing to win the CFP Trophy to finish out the 2025-26 season.

	Scheduled for Monday, Jan. 19, the game airs on ESPN â€” who is expecting for high ratings for the CFP event in early 2026 â€” so if you want to catch the game, there are a number of ways to watch online.

	
		Whoâ€™s Playing During 2026 College Football Playoff National Championship Game?	

	The CFP National Championship finds the No. 10-ranked Miami Hurricanes (13-2) with head coach Mario Cristobal playing against the No. 1-ranked Indiana Hoosiers (15-0) with head coach Curt Cignetti at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, Florida starting at 7:30 p.m. ET/4:30 p.m. PT on ESPN.


	Miami enters the game as the underdog, while Indiana is the clear favorites â€” especially with the teamâ€™s undefeated record. But, the season isnâ€™t over with Miami taking on the role of spoiler, if the Hurricanes pull out the win. With the eyes of college sports on Hard Rock Stadium today, it should be an exciting and heart-thumping match up.

	However, even without cable, you donâ€™t have to miss any of the action this season. The CFP National Championship game is also available to stream online on a variety of platforms, such as DirecTV, Fubo, Sling TV, Hulu + Live TV and ESPN Unlimited.

However, soul recording artist Jamal Roberts is set to perform â€œThe Star-Spangled Banner,â€ the United States National Anthem, while the Florida Memorial University Ambassador Chorale perform â€œAmerica the Beautiful.â€

title: Timothy Busfield Edited Out of Amazon MGM Movie â€˜You Deserve Each Otherâ€™ Following Child Sex Abuse Allegations
description: Timothy Busfield will be edited out of the upcoming Amazon MGM film â€œYou Deserve Each Otherâ€ after he was accused of groping a 7-year-old boy on the
body:
Timothy Busfield will be edited out of the upcoming Amazon MGM film â€œYou Deserve Each Otherâ€ after he was accused of groping a 7-year-old boy on the set of â€œThe Cleaning Lady,â€ Variety had learned.

	This is the second project involving Busfield to be affected in the wake of his sexual abuse allegations. On Jan. 12, NBC pulled an episode of â€œLaw & Order: SVUâ€ that guest-starred Busfield from its schedule. The episode was set to debut on Jan. 22.
	

	On Jan. 9, an arrest warrant was issued against Busfield on two counts of sexual abuse involving a minor. The investigation stems from twin boys who appeared on the TV series â€œThe Cleaning Ladyâ€ in 2022. Busfield was the director at the time.


	On Jan. 13, Busfield turned himself in at the Metro Detention Center in Albuquerque. He will remain there until his court hearing on Tuesday. He faces three charges â€” two counts of criminal sexual contact with a child, which carry a maximum sentence of six years each, and one count of child abuse, which carries a maximum of three years.

	Busfield was top billed in â€œYou Deserve Each Otherâ€ on IMDb, which could suggest a significant contribution to the picture. Other cast members include Penn Badgley, Meghann Fahy, Justin Long, Kyle MacLachlan, Natalie Morales, Ana Gasteyer, Hope Davis, Delaney Rowe and Lisa Gilroy.

	The film is directed by Marc Silverstein and Abby Kohn and is based on Sarah Hogleâ€™s novel of the same name. According to the official logline, the film follows â€œNaomi (Fahy) and Nick (Badgley) who are about to get married and live happily ever after â€“â€“ the only problem being theyâ€™ve fallen completely out of love. With the wedding rapidly approaching and its pressure mounting, they both resolve to secretly push the other into calling off the wedding, only to fall back in love along the way.â€

schema.headline: Timothy Busfield Edited Out of Amazon MGM Movie â€˜You Deserve Each Otherâ€™ Following Child Sex Abuse Allegations

title: ESPN and Words + Pictures Partner for Six-Part Nick Saban Docuseries
description: ESPN and Words + Pictures have unveiled their new six-part docuseries â€œSaban,â€ which chronicles the life and storied career of the former University
body:
ESPN and Words + Pictures have unveiled their new six-part docuseries â€œSaban,â€ which chronicles the life and storied career of the former University of Alabama football coach Nick Saban.

	According to an official logline, â€œthe series will tell the story of Nick Sabanâ€™s extraordinary career, highlighted by his 17 seasons at Alabama, where he led the team to six national titles and reestablished the Crimson Tide as the preeminent program in college football.â€
	

	â€œWith my coaching days behind me, Ms. Terry and I have been doing a lot of reflection and realized we were ready to tell our story,â€ Nick Saban said. â€œThe team at Words + Pictures has encouraged me to really look back not just at my time at Alabama, but every stop along the way â€“ and not just reflect on what happened but consider the process which made it happen. I interacted with a lot of players and coaches along the way and Iâ€™m happy to see that so many of them have contributed to this docuseries. Thereâ€™s a lot to tell, and Iâ€™m excited to share it all.â€


	Russell Dinallo serves as director while Connor Schell, Libby Geist, Aaron Cohen, Alexa Conway and Tom Rinaldi will produce under Words + Pictures. Gabe Honig serves as showrunner and co-executive producer.

	â€œThere will never be another Nick Saban,â€ said Schell, CEO of Words + Pictures. â€œHeâ€™s a football genius, a singular leader, and a true icon who has done more than anyone to shape the modern game of college football and the culture around it.â€

	Details such as premiere date and episode rollout will be revealed at a later date.
	

	Check out the teaser below.

schema.headline: ESPN and Words + Pictures Partner for Six-Part Nick Saban Docuseries

title: How Valentino Made Hollywood the Enduring Obsession of the Fashion World
description: At Variety, we talk a lot about the soft power of the red carpet. We live in an age where â€œimage architectâ€ is a vaunted job title, thanks to the se
body:
At Variety, we talk a lot about the soft power of the red carpet. We live in an age where â€œimage architectâ€ is a vaunted job title, thanks to the serious economic and cultural impact the right look can offer stars and brands. 

	We can largely thank Valentino Garavani, who died at 93 on Monday, for creating this mutually beneficial relationship. In the late â€™70s, European fashion houses became global enterprises. As the designer of deeply glamorous and dreamlike gowns, Mr. Valentino (as he was known) saw the writing on the wall. Celebrities and artists â€” particularly actresses â€” would come to reinvent how fashion captivated culture and commerce. His muses are renowned, from Jackie Kennedy to Gwyneth Paltrow, Julia Roberts to Cate Blanchett.
	

	Celebrated documentary filmmaker Matt Tyrnauer (above, far right) chronicled the designerâ€™s opulent lifestyle and pioneering spirit in the 2008 movie â€œValentino: The Last Emperor.â€ The project premiered at the Venice Film Festival that year, and would spark a subgenre of fashion docs that gave glimpses into the pain, mess and belief it takes to inspire the masses and sell big.


	We caught up with Tyrnauer just hours after the Valentino news hit, drawing tributes from the likes of Paltrow and Colman Domingo, to discuss the designerâ€™s legacy in show business and his notoriously mercurial personality. 
	
		Your movie, now almost 20 years old, shows how prescient Valentino was in bringing celebrities into the fashion world. What will his legacy be in our town? 	

	Valentino was at the forefront of Hollywoodâ€™s love affair with fashion in the late 20th century and the early 21st. He was one of the first high fashion designers to embrace movie stars hardcore. Before that, fashion was really focused on socialites and aristocrats. It was Valentino and his partner, Giancarlo Giammetti, who really pushed hard to have actresses wear his clothes. Being a global movie star at that time was an extraordinarily potent type of fame. Fashion began to be redefined by movie stars wearing your clothes, not only out in public or on the red carpet, but sometimes in the films themselves. Valentino was essential for that movement from high society to Hollywood being an important part of the fashion universe.
	
	
		Who were some of his biggest muses? 	

	Elizabeth Taylor and, in Italy, Monica Vitti were two of the first. Through the years, we saw Gwyneth Paltrow, Anne Hathaway, the â€œKatesâ€ (meaning Cate Blanchett and Kate Winslet), Claire Danes, Julia Roberts. It was Jackie Kennedy, though not a movie star, who was the glamorous woman who made him a household name. She was the first First Lady to bring a movie-star-level candlepower to that position.
	
		You had unprecedented access to Valentino for your film. Whatâ€™s the thing that will stay with you?	

	I never saw anyone live a lifestyle like Valentino. It was so over the top, beyond description. There were villas and chateaus and chalets and Fifth Avenue apartments. Not one pug, not two pugs, but five pugs. And multiple servants in white gloves to tend to the pugs. Gianni Agnelli famously said, â€I live like a king, but Valentino lives better than me. And I donâ€™t know how he does it.â€ 
	
		You were very open about having big creative disagreements with Valentino during filming. How do you reflect on it now?	

	What really defined the whole production was the warm embrace of Valentino, and then the really unspeakable tantrum. It was a seesawing motion throughout, and I put some of that in the film. He had no editorial control over the film. He hated the film. When he first saw it, it premiered at the Venice Film Festival. He got a 10-minute standing ovation after, and he quickly turned into a big fan. He was extraordinary at doing the press attendant to the film, which was a surprise hit. I have nothing but affection and fondness and respect for Valentino and Giancarlo Giamatti. They were absolutely extraordinary people to spend that much time with, and they really did let me into their world. It was extremely brave. At the end of the day, we went into the success of the film arm-in-arm. It was an unforgettable moment. And it really did go around the world. It was a very happy ending.

schema.headline: How Valentino Made Hollywood the Enduring Obsession of the Fashion World

title: â€˜Marty Supremeâ€™ Surpasses $100 Million Globally, Fourth A24 Film to Hit Box Office Milestone
description:
Donâ€™t doubt the hustle of Marty Mauser.

	A24â€˜s â€œMarty Supreme,â€ a sports dramedy starring TimothÃ©e Chalamet as a fictional table tennis champ, has
body:
Donâ€™t doubt the hustle of Marty Mauser.

	A24â€˜s â€œMarty Supreme,â€ a sports dramedy starring TimothÃ©e Chalamet as a fictional table tennis champ, has surpassed $100 million globally. Itâ€™s the fourth A24 release to ever cross this box office milestone after 2022â€™s Oscar best picture winner â€œEverything Everywhere All at Onceâ€ ($142 million), 2024â€™s dystopian thriller â€œCivil Warâ€ ($127 million) and last yearâ€™s romantic drama â€œMaterialistsâ€ ($107 million). This benchmark is especially impressive because itâ€™s been a challenging time for arthouse releases; â€œMarty Supremeâ€ and â€œMaterialistsâ€ were 2025â€™s only independent films to generate above $100 million.
	

	Thanks to Chalametâ€™s unconventional marketing efforts and glowing word-of-mouth from critics and audiences, â€œMarty Supremeâ€ has earned $102.3 million worldwide, including $80.8 million in the United States and $21.5 million overseas. Top international markets include the United Kingdom with $16 million, Canada with $5.7 million and Mexico with $944,000. (Canada is traditionally a part of North American grosses, but A24 only distributes its films in the U.S. and partners with companies such as Entertainment Film Distributors, Elevation and Sun Distribution Group for other territories.)


	â€œMarty Supremeâ€ recently became A24â€™s highest-grossing movie in the U.S. after overtaking the benchmark held by â€œEverything Everywhere All at Onceâ€ with $77 million. Where â€œMartyâ€ will end up on A24â€™s worldwide charts remains to be seen. However, the film is likely to remain a draw in the States through awards season, and itâ€™s yet to be released in several overseas markets. â€œMarty Supremeâ€ debuts next weekend in 12 territories, including Australia,Â Brazil and Italy.
	

	â€œMarty Supremeâ€ cost $70 million, which makes it A24â€™s most expensive film to date and means it hasnâ€™t climbed out of the red. (Remember: Theater owners keep about half of ticket sales.) However, â€œMarty Supremeâ€ has been valuable to A24 on the awards circuit (Chalamet won the Golden Globe and Critics Choice for best actor) and is expected to be a major contender when Oscar nominations are announced on Thursday. Josh Safdie directed the frenetic, R-rated adventure, which follows Marty Mauser as he goes through hell and back to pursue his dream of becoming the worldâ€™s best ping pong player.

schema.headline: â€˜Marty Supremeâ€™ Surpasses $100 Million Globally, Fourth A24 Film to Hit Box Office Milestone

title: Former White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre Reveals Sheâ€™ll Host the AAFCA Film Awards and Reflects on Why Her â€˜Career Has Been a Zigzagâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
Karine Jean-Pierre is ready to take the stage.

	The former White House press secretary for President Joe Biden is stepping into a new kind of spotl
body:
Karine Jean-Pierre is ready to take the stage.

	The former White House press secretary for President Joe Biden is stepping into a new kind of spotlight as the host of this yearâ€™s 17th annual African American Film Critics Awards, revealed exclusively to Variety.

	Jean-Pierre, 51, joins an impressive roster of earlier AAFCA emcees, following last yearâ€™s Amber Ruffin, the comedian who led the film ceremony, and â€œAmerican Idolâ€ Season 6 winner Jordin Sparks, who hosted the organizationâ€™s 2025 television honors. The ceremony, celebrating achievements in filmmaking, will take place Feb. 8 in Los Angeles.
	

	Honorees this year include Michael B. Jordan, Tessa Thompson and director Ryan Coogler, alongside animated feature breakout â€œKPop Demon Hunters.â€ Winners are selected by more than 100 members of the African American Film Critics Association.


	Jean-Pierre is no stranger to making history. She served as the 35th White House press secretary from 2022 to 2025, becoming the first Black person and the first openly LGBTQ individual to hold the role. Hosting the awards marks a notable shift in trajectory for the veteran political adviser, and one she does not take lightly.

	â€œI donâ€™t want it to be about me,â€ Jean-Pierre tells Variety. â€œIâ€™m playing a tiny part here. My job is to honor, celebrate and lift the brilliant artists who are being recognized.â€

	Jean-Pierre has long admired AAFCAâ€™s mission and leadership, making it â€œan easy yesâ€ to accept the hosting gig. â€œThe AAFCA Awards have spent 17 years celebrating extraordinary contributions in film, and I am just so in awe of Gil Robertson and the team,â€ she says. â€œThe mission is to honor storytellers who explore the many faces of humanity through diverse perspectives. Why not help lift that up?â€
	

	Despite being one of the most recognizable communicators in American politics, Jean-Pierre is adamant that the evening will remain focused on the artists. â€œOne of the things I learned in the press comms world is donâ€™t make yourself the news,â€ she says. â€œI want it to be light, enjoyable, smooth and let the stars shine.â€

	With politics touching nearly every facet of daily life, Jean-Pierreâ€™s post-White House career has differed from her predecessors. One would have expected her to pivot into cable news or become a political pundit, a common next step for former press secretaries. When asked about whether that absence was a conscious choice, Jean-Pierre is direct, describing her career as one that has never been about following a prescribed route.

	â€œIâ€™ve always seen myself as someone who does things differently,â€ she says. â€œI donâ€™t follow a set path or look at the people before me and copy their trajectory â€” thatâ€™s just never been who I am. I like to do things my own way and ask myself, â€˜How can I make an impact? How can I be different?â€™â€

	Among those sheâ€™s excited to meet are several of the nightâ€™s honorees, particularly the cast and filmmakers behind â€œSinners,â€ which she calls â€œone of the most brilliant pieces of work Iâ€™ve seen in a long time.â€

	â€œIâ€™ve never met Michael B. Jordan,â€ she says with excitement. â€œAnd Ryan Coogler â€” just touching him would be amazing. Heâ€™s so incredibly brilliant.â€

	Jean-Pierre, who recently published her memoir â€œIndependent,â€ says hosting aligns with a broader desire to tell stories beyond the political arena. While she plans to remain engaged in civic discourse after two decades in politics, she views this next chapter as an opportunity to expand her impact through storytelling and mentorship.

	After spending 20 years in politics, Jean-Pierre says her focus is now on lifting up communities she cares about. Most recently, she acquired the rights to the stories of Alice Dunnigan and Ethel Payne, the first two Black women to serve in the White House press corps, and wants Hollywood to tell their stories.  â€œThe women asked presidents questions and were often ignored by the boysâ€™ club, and yet so few people know their names,â€ Jean-Pierre says with passion. â€œI recently acquired their books, and I want to help bring their stories to life.â€
	

	In November 2023, while still serving as press secretary, she honored their legacy by dedicating the White House lectern in their names.

	Her next career chapter, she says, will focus on telling stories that matter â€” potentially as a producer and writer â€” while continuing to mentor young people and develop new writing projects.

	â€œMy career has always been a zigzag,â€ she says. â€œI move toward what excites me and what feels meaningful, and thatâ€™s how I want to continue doing things: my way.â€

	Still, Jean-Pierre acknowledges that hosting an awards ceremony during a moment of political and cultural turbulence carries added weight.

	â€œWe need this right now,â€ she asserts. â€œWe need an opportunity and a space to celebrate ourselves â€” to be seen in this way, and for little boys and girls in our community to see us in this way.â€

	As conversations around diversity and inclusion remain fraught, Jean-Pierre views events like the AAFCA Awards as essential.

	â€œWe cannot let our stories die. We must continue to be bold and tell those stories. There is real value in telling our journeys so that generations to come can see how brilliant we are.â€

	Gil Robertson, AAFCA president and co-founder, said he is â€œelatedâ€ to welcome Jean-Pierre into the organizationâ€™s family.

	â€œSheâ€™s current, credible and brilliant,â€ Robertson says. â€œShe has a background in journalism and has occupied positions at the very center of popular events. We love her energy and her vibe, and itâ€™s what people expect from us â€” smart hosts who are part of the conversation.â€

	As Jean-Pierre prepares to take the stage, her approach stays rooted in service, just as it was behind the White House podium.

	â€œMy message is to continue to hold each other,â€ she says. â€œTelling our stories is more important now than it has ever been before.â€

schema.headline: Former White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre Reveals Sheâ€™ll Host the AAFCA Film Awards and Reflects on Why Her â€˜Career Has Been a Zigzagâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Woody Harrelson Got â€˜So Pissedâ€™ at Matthew McConaughey While Filming â€˜True Detectiveâ€™ Because He Went Method: â€˜I Wanted to Punch This Motherfâ€”â€“ In the Faceâ€™
description: Matthew McConaughey recently joined Woody Harrelson and Ted Danson on their â€œWhere Everybody Knows Your Nameâ€ podcast. During the episode, Harrelson
body:
Matthew McConaughey recently joined Woody Harrelson and Ted Danson on their â€œWhere Everybody Knows Your Nameâ€ podcast. During the episode, Harrelson recalled there were â€œso many timesâ€ he wanted to â€œpunchâ€ McConaughey while filming the first season of â€œTrue Detectiveâ€ because he was method acting.

	â€œHeâ€™s method,â€ Harrelson said. â€œWhen we were shooting, he was Rust Cohle. There [were] so many times I wanted to punch this motherfucker in the face. Iâ€™m so pissed at him cause heâ€™s in his character.â€
	

	McConaughey explained that he needed to be â€œstoicâ€ between takes to stay in his characterâ€™s headspace.


	â€œWeâ€™re sitting there. Weâ€™re about to start shooting, and we were rehearsing,â€ McConaughey recalled. â€œIâ€™m just kind of being stoic Rust Cohle. Woody goes, like, â€˜Hey man, I need to talk to you about something.â€™ He goes, â€˜The way you and I work, McConaughey, I hit you the ball, you hit back, I hit it back to you. We volley, we play. â€¦ Man, thatâ€™s us. Itâ€™s dramatic, but itâ€™s also comedy.'â€

	In HBOâ€™s â€œTrue Detective,â€ Harrelson and McConaughey played a pair of Southern investigators hunting a serial killer in the esoteric back country of Louisiana. Harrelson, at one point, thought the show was too dark and suggested to McConaughey during production that they should add in some jokes.

	He recalled, â€œI remember saying to [McConaughey] before we started filming, Iâ€™m like, â€˜Dude, people are gonna expect to laugh with us. We gotta throw some jokes in here.â€™ Heâ€™s just like, â€˜Mhm.â€™ Iâ€™m waiting for him to say, â€˜Yeah, youâ€™re totally, no, none of that.â€™ He just, â€˜Mhm, yeah.â€™â€
	

	â€œTrue Detectiveâ€ Season 1 earned 5 Emmy Awards and is still widely considered one of the best shows in HBOâ€™s catalog. Despite the enduring popularity, Harrelson recently told â€œTodayâ€ that there is â€œno chanceâ€ of him and McConaughey returning to â€œTrue Detective.â€

	â€œIn fairness, never. No chance,â€ Harrelson said. â€œBecause it turned out great. I love that it turned out the way it did, and if anything, doing another season would, I think, tarnish that.â€

schema.headline: Woody Harrelson Got â€˜So Pissedâ€™ at Matthew McConaughey While Filming â€˜True Detectiveâ€™ Because He Went Method: â€˜I Wanted to Punch This Motherfâ€”â€“ In the Faceâ€™

          Rihanna wasnâ€™t about to stay shut out -- after her bodyguard let a door hit her in the face, she fired off a perfect clapback, all caught on cam!
      
    
          The singer was stepping out of NYCâ€™s Four Seasons on Friday when a door swung straight into her face as her bodyguard strolled right on ahead -- prompting her to laugh it off and clap back, "Such a gentleman you are!"
      
    
          TBF, he wasnâ€™t totally checked out -- he just seemed way more focused on the pack of paps rushing in and forgot Rihanna was right behind him.

          One thingâ€™s clear though ... Rihanna can handle herself, and no doorâ€™s bold enough to shut her down!

title: President Trump Cheered At Miami vs. Indiana Championship Game
description:
President Trump
                          Crowd Goes Wild
                          At National T
body:
President Trump
                          Crowd Goes Wild
                          At National Title Game
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 19, 2026
                            5:52 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          President Donald Trump was in friendly territory at the CFP National Championship on Monday ... with a loud applause breaking out when he was shown during the national anthem.
      
    
          Nos. 45-47 hit Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens for the Miami vs. Indiana matchup ... and he brought Ivanka, Kai, and some more grandkids along for the ride.
      
    
      
      The crowd at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami roars as @POTUS is shown during the Star-Spangled Banner :us: pic.twitter.com/gqQ3ojBXhoâ€” Rapid Response 47 (@RapidResponse47) January 20, 2026
              @RapidResponse47
          
  
    
          Trump's presence was felt early in the night ... 'cause as "American Idol" star Jamal Roberts performed his rendition of the "Star-Spangled Banner," the cams cut to him on the big screens.
      

          While Trump's gotten cheers, boos and everything in between over the years, this is Florida we're talking about ... so naturally, those in attendance went nuts when he popped up for all to see.
      
    
      
      â€œDOWNLOAD THE TICKETS AND GET IN EARLYâ€ - Danny Boy Cane(I think this is the line to get into the line to get into the stadium) pic.twitter.com/DSjnTLUv1wâ€” Ohioâ€™s Tate (@BarstoolTate) January 19, 2026
              @BarstoolTate
          
  
    
          The White House confirmed days ago Trump would soak in all the action in person ... and as TMZ Sports reported, local officials beefed up security to make sure the night went off without a hitch.
      
    
          That being said, lines to get into the stadium were pretty long hours before kickoff ... but it looked like a packed house once things were underway.
      
    
          Other notable attendees include Jake Paul, Tom Brady, DJ Khaled and Mark Cuban ... so it was the place to be Monday night.

title: Anti-ICE Church Protester Has Zero Regrets, Scoffs at DOJ Threat
description:
St. Paul Church ICE Protester
                          Desperate Times, Desperate Measures!!!
body:
St. Paul Church ICE Protester
                          Desperate Times, Desperate Measures!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 19, 2026
                            6:00 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          Local and federal authorities are investigating after a group of anti-ICE protesters crashed a Minnesota church service ... and one of the demonstrators tells TMZ she'd still do it all over again.
      
    
          Here's the deal ... the DOJ and local police are investigating after protesters interrupted a service at the Cities Church in St. Paul ... which is getting major headlines because Don Lemon was in the mix live-streaming the incident.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TikTok/@donlemon
          
    
          Chauntyll Allen, leader of Black Lives Matter Twin Cities, who was among the group, tells TMZ â€¦ the jarring protest inside the church was necessary to make clear to the parishioners that having a pastor who is also an ICE official is unacceptable.
      

          Chauntyll, who's also a St. Paul School Board member, argues the community is being ripped apart by ICE â€¦ so the group disrupting a church service -- and upsetting some parishioners -- in comparison is pretty small potatoes.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          The protesters have been dragged by people on the Right for going inside the church ... but Chauntyll tells us she doesnâ€™t think a line was crossed â€¦ and she would do it again if given the opportunity.
      
    
          As for the threats of possible criminal charges ... as you can see in the video, Chauntyll couldn't care less, and argues the feds have vastly bigger fish to fry.
      
    
          We spoke to a Cities Church member who feels the complete opposite ... and who welcomes authorities sending a message that this type of behavior is unacceptable. And it seems President Trump agrees ... sharing a social media post that Lemon specifically should be locked away.

title: Valentine's Day Gift Ideas For All The Clueless Guys
description: TMZ may collect a share of sa
body:
TMZ may collect a share of sales or other compensation from links on this page.
      
    
          Valentine's Day can be a high-stakes affair for plenty of guys, and we don't want you to end up walking home feeling dejected ... just because you were a clueless dude and blew it with your girlfriend's gift.
      
    
          We don't like seeing frowning faces, and we figured we'd step in to help -- we've put together a guide for anyone out there who needs a bit of extra help picking out something nice to slide across the dinner table.
      
    
          Listen, showing up with something's always better than making it to your girlfriend's place empty-handed, and we've picked out a few things we think would put a smile on her face ... Â you can take all the credit, it's cool with us!
      
    
          TMZ Cheatsheet: V-Day Gift Ideas for Clueless Dudes
  

          Fuji Instax: $140Spice It Up: $25Aura Frame: $179Heart Necklace: $200BBQ Accessories: $60My Wife Is Hotter Than You Shirt: $17
      
    
              
      Fuji Instax
      
        
    
                  
                          
                  
      
    
          Ever been through those moments you just wish would last forever? Well, if your girl's got a fixation on photography, the Fuji Instax pops photos out in a flash for her to keep forever!
      
    
          Plus, this little camera's perfect to keep in a purse or crossbody bag, so she won't have to worry about lugging around photo equipment -- just point, smile, and shoot!
      
    
              
      Spice It Up Game
      
        
    
                  
                          
                  
      
    
          You know the feeling when you're all jazzed up and ready to hang out with your girl ... and you've got nothing planned besides that? Spice It Up gets the conversation -- and plenty more, if you play your cards right -- going in an instant!
      
    
          Plus, if your Valentine's Day plans end relatively early, this game's got plenty of suggestions for some post-dinner fun we think she'll really be into, like movies on the couch, something spicier ... or both. ğŸ˜˜
      
    
              
      Aura Frame
      
        
    
                  
                          
                  
      
    
          Picture this ... your girlfriend's got plenty of great photos in her camera roll, and she wants to frame and display each and every single one of them but doesn't have the wall space -- the Aura Frame is the perfect way for her to show off her hard work.
      
    
          Friends and family alike, she's gonna like this a whole lot better than endlessly scrolling through her phone ... and she'll have you to thank for it.
      
    
              
      Heart Necklace
      
        
    
                  
                          
                  
      
    
          Unless you've been living under a rock, you'd know a classic never gets old ... which is absolutely the case with good, old-school heart necklaces -- they have been and always will be a solid V-Day choice for girlfriends everywhere.
      
    
          You're going to have to do a bit of homework for this one, though, because you've got to figure out if she's a silver or gold type of person -- or just get both and let her decide!
      
    
              
      BBQ Accessories
      
        
    
                  
                          
                  
      
    
          We know Valentine's Day can be tough on couples, and if you're mulling over the idea of going it solo after one last dinner, this 40-piece set of BBQ accessories would be the perfect gift to give her -- well, yourself -- right before that convo about breaking up.
      
    
          Hey, you gave it your best shot, and no one can take that away from you ... and we figure these accessories would be perfect for whipping up something nice to celebrate your newfound singlehood!
      
    
              
      My Wife Is Hotter Than You T-Shirt
      
        
    
                  
                          
                  
      
    
          Okay, it's finally time to drop the subtlety with your lady and make sure everyone knows exactly who you're going home with at the end of the night -- every night -- by wearing this t-shirt.
      
    
          Sure, you might get some laughs in public, but you'll definitely be feeling -- and getting -- lucky when you wear this around your girl!
      
    
          Sign up for Amazon PrimeÂ to get the best deals!
      
    
          All prices subject to change.

schema.headline: Valentine's Day Gift Ideas For All The Clueless Guys
